00004 /**
00005  * @file

00017 /**
00018  * @defgroup slpjq SlipJaq
00019  * @{
00020  */
00021 
00022 /**
00023  * @name Installation hook functions
00024  * @{
00025  */
00026 
00027 /**
00028  * Implementation of hook_install().
00029  *
00030  * To maximize code reusability, we simply pull in our admin
00031  * configuration form, which contains all of our variable names
00032  * and defaults.
00033  */
00034 function slpjq_install() {
00035   $form = slpjq_install_get_config_form();
00036   foreach ($form as $field => $attrs) {
00037     variable_set($field, $attrs['#default_value']);
00038   }
00039 }
00040 
00041 
00042 /**
00043  * Implementation of hook_uninstall().
00044  *
00045  * We use the same reusability technique as we did above with
00046  * slpjq_install().
00047  */
00048 function slpjq_uninstall() {
00049   $form = slpjq_install_get_config_form();
00050   foreach ($form as $field => $attrs) {
00051     variable_del($field);
00052   }
00053 }
00054 /* @} Installation hook functions */
00055 
00056 /**
00057  * @name Installation internal functions
00058  * @{
00059  */
00060 
00061 /**
00062  * Load up our full module and invoke slpjq_get_config_form().
00063  */
00064 function slpjq_install_get_config_form() {
00065   if (!function_exists('slpjq_get_config_form')) {
00066     require_once('slpjq.module');
00067   }
00068   return slpjq_get_config_form();
00069 }
00070 /* @} Installation internal functions*/
00071 /* @} SlipJaq */
